results.title: Simvastatin attenuates hypomyelination induced by hypoxia-ischemia in neonatal rats.

results.title: Anti-inflammatory Therapy With Simvastatin Improves Neuroinflammation and CNS Function in a Mouse Model of Metachromatic Leukodystrophy.
results.text_hl: Treatment of the @<m>DISEASE_Demyelinating_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003711 @@@demyelinating@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model with the nonsteroidal anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ drug @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced @DISEASE_Neuroinflammatory_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D000090862 @@@neuroinflammation@@@, improved the swimming performance and ataxic gait, and retarded @<m>DISEASE_Demyelinating_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003711 @@@demyelination of@@@ the @DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@spinal cord@@@.

citations.NLM: Stein A, Stroobants S, Gieselmann V, D'Hooge R, Matzner U. Anti-inflammatory Therapy With Simvastatin Improves Neuroinflammation and CNS Function in a Mouse Model of Metachromatic Leukodystrophy. Mol Ther. 2015 Jul;23(7):1160-1168. PMID: 25896249
citations.BibTeX: @article{25896249, title={Anti-inflammatory Therapy With Simvastatin Improves Neuroinflammation and CNS Function in a Mouse Model of Metachromatic Leukodystrophy.}, author={Stein A and Stroobants S and Gieselmann V and D'Hooge R and Matzner U}, journal={Mol Ther}, volume={23}, number={7}, pages={1160-1168}}

results.title: Statins' immunomodulatory potential against Th17 cell-mediated autoimmune response.
results.text_hl: In addition to the statin-mediated effect on the monocyte cytokine production, which regulates Th17 cell differentiation, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ directly inhibits @GENE_IL17A @GENE_3605 @@@IL-17@@@ production in @GENE_CD4 @GENE_920 @@@CD4@@@+ cells, which may collectively inhibit the @DISEASE_Autoimmune_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001327 @@@autoimmune@@@ response in @DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009103 @@@multiple sclerosis@@@ (@DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009103 @@@MS@@@), a @DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@central nervous system@@@ (@DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@CNS@@@) @<m>DISEASE_Demyelinating_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003711 @@@inflammatory demyelinating disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhang X, Markovic-Plese S. Statins' immunomodulatory potential against Th17 cell-mediated autoimmune response. Immunol Res. 2008;41(3):165-74. PMID: 18484192
citations.BibTeX: @article{18484192, title={Statins' immunomodulatory potential against Th17 cell-mediated autoimmune response.}, author={Zhang X and Markovic-Plese S}, journal={Immunol Res}, volume={41}, number={3}, pages={165-74}}

results.title: Simvastatin treatment improves functional recovery after experimental spinal cord injury by upregulating the expression of BDNF and GDNF.
results.text_hl: Results show that the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated animals showed significantly better locomotor function recovery, better electrophysiological outcome, less @<m>DISEASE_Demyelinating_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003711 @@@myelin loss@@@, and higher expression of @GENE_BDNF @GENE_24225 @@@BDNF@@@ and @GENE_GDNF @GENE_25453 @@@GDNF@@@.

citations.NLM: Han X, Yang N, Xu Y, Zhu J, Chen Z, Liu Z, Dang G, Song C. Simvastatin treatment improves functional recovery after experimental spinal cord injury by upregulating the expression of BDNF and GDNF. Neurosci Lett. 2011 Jan 10;487(3):255-9. PMID: 20851742
citations.BibTeX: @article{20851742, title={Simvastatin treatment improves functional recovery after experimental spinal cord injury by upregulating the expression of BDNF and GDNF.}, author={Han X and Yang N and Xu Y and Zhu J and Chen Z and Liu Z and Dang G and Song C}, journal={Neurosci Lett}, volume={487}, number={3}, pages={255-9}}

results.title: Simvastatin ameliorates cauda equina compression injury in a rat model of lumbar spinal stenosis.
results.text_hl: Cellular Infiltration and @<m>DISEASE_Demyelinating_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003711 @@@demyelination@@@ decreased in the spinal cord from the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Shunmugavel A, Martin MM, Khan M, Copay AG, Subach BR, Schuler TC, Singh I. Simvastatin ameliorates cauda equina compression injury in a rat model of lumbar spinal stenosis. J Neuroimmune Pharmacol. 2013 Mar;8(1):274-86. PMID: 23188522
